element.name: Bully for you by snoopyandmickey, Multi-cache (2/2)

long-description.p: Bull Island or more properly North Bull Island is an island located in Dublin Bay in Ireland, about 5 km (3.1 mi) long and 800 m wide, lying roughly parallel to the shore. It is less than two centuries old, having been formed by sand building up after the North Bull Wall (designed by Capt. William Bligh, of Bounty fame) was completed in the early 19th century to keep clear the channel to Dublin Port.
Take a walk and enjoy the views. Before you find the cache you will have to obtain some numbers.

You can access the cache at the above start point. Please then go to N53 21.057 W6 09.737 and note the full date that the statue was blessed by Cardinal Gregory Peter Agagianian. Convert into digits and call this A.B.C.D.E.F.G
Also at this location count the uplighters and call this H
You are now ready to find the cache!
You will now have numbers for A B C D E F G H.
You may not need all the numbers!
To find the cache go to N53.(C+E+F).(G+H)(H)(F+G+A) W06.(B+G).(F-A-D)HC

center.font: Visit the Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

ul.li:
2010-06-13T19:00:00Z : Write note by abra123cadabra
Didn't see the Keltencoin GC in the cache. Maybe one of the previous cachers forgot to log it.

2010-06-13T19:00:00Z : Found it by abra123cadabra
We had the final coordinates for quite a while now.
The first time the final location was fenced off for some construction work. The second time we didn't have the patience to search for long as it was difficult to avoid all the dog droppings. Today we decided to go and get it. And we did.
Don't know how we could have overlooked it the previous time but it's definitely there. A bit prickly, though. Very busy on Bull Island today. The Dollymount Sea Scouts were out with their kayaks, fighting against the wind. There must also have been a swimming event. Met lots of dripping wet men after they braved the sea. Good we didn't come by car and just walked over.
Out: GC Die Templer

2010-06-05T19:00:00Z : Found it by eve1987
Found together with GudrunXY, who has done most of the work before!
TFTC, eve

2010-06-05T19:00:00Z : Write note by GudrunXY
Forgot to log TB in. GudrunXY

2010-06-05T19:00:00Z : Found it by GudrunXY
I was here a few weeks ago and must have calculated wrong, as the cords would have sent me 10 kilometers or so away. The owner was so nice to correct them for me. Thanks!!! Finding the cache was quite easy. TFTC, GudrunXY
IN: TB

wpt.name: GC18VBG
wpt.desc: Bully for you by snoopyandmickey, Multi-cache (2/2)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Bully for you
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Bull Island or more properly North Bull Island is an island located in Dublin Bay in Ireland, about 5 km (3.1 mi) long and 800 m wide, lying roughly parallel to the shore. It is less than two centuries old, having been formed by sand building up after the North Bull Wall (designed by Capt. William Bligh, of Bounty fame) was completed in the early 19th century to keep clear the channel to Dublin Port.

Take a walk and enjoy the views. Before you find the cache you will have to obtain some numbers.

Stage one

You can access the cache at the above start point. Please then go to N53 21.057 W6 09.737 and note the full date that the statue was blessed by Cardinal Gregory Peter Agagianian. Convert into digits and call this A.B.C.D.E.F.G

Also at this location count the uplighters and call this H

Final Location

You are now ready to find the cache!

You will now have numbers for A B C D E F G H.

You may not need all the numbers!

To find the cache go to N53.(C+E+F).(G+H)(H)(F+G+A) W06.(B+G).(F-A-D)HC


Snoopy and Mickey


"Enjoy the cache!"

Visit the Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

Additional Waypoints

FN18VBG - Final
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

S118VBG - Stage 1
N 53° 21.057 W 006° 09.737

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text: Didn't see the Keltencoin GC in the cache. Maybe one of the previous cachers forgot to log it.

We had the final coordinates for quite a while now.
The first time the final location was fenced off for some construction work. The second time we didn't have the patience to search for long as it was difficult to avoid all the dog droppings. Today we decided to go and get it. And we did.
Don't know how we could have overlooked it the previous time but it's definitely there. A bit prickly, though. Very busy on Bull Island today. The Dollymount Sea Scouts were out with their kayaks, fighting against the wind. There must also have been a swimming event. Met lots of dripping wet men after they braved the sea. Good we didn't come by car and just walked over.
Out: GC Die Templer

Found together with GudrunXY, who has done most of the work before!
TFTC, eve
Forgot to log TB in. GudrunXY

I was here a few weeks ago and must have calculated wrong, as the cords would have sent me 10 kilometers or so away. The owner was so nice to correct them for me. Thanks!!! Finding the cache was quite easy. TFTC, GudrunXY
IN: TB
